fields.title: Área de un triángulo
fields.code:
a = 5
b = 6
c = 7
s = (a + b + c) / 2
area = (s*(s-a)*(s-b)*(s-c)) ** 0.5
print('El área del triángulo es %0.2f.' %area)
print()

fields.title: Utilizando NumPy
fields.code:
import numpy as np

array = np.array([
	[3, 7, 1],
	[10, 3, 2],
	[5, 6, 7]
])

print(array)
print()
print(np.sort(array, axis=None))
print(np.sort(array, axis=1))
print(np.sort(array, axis=0))

fields.title: Utilizando SciPy
fields.code:
from scipy import linalg
import numpy as np

arr = np.array([[5,4],[6,3]])
eg_val, eg_vect = linalg.eig(arr)
print(eg_val)
print(eg_vect)
print()

fields.title: Importando Matplotlib
fields.code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

x = np.random.randn(1000)
y = np.random.randn(1000)
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
ax.scatter(x, y)
fig

fields.title: Importando Pandas
fields.code:
import pandas as pd

df = pd.DataFrame({
	'num_legs': [2, 4, 8, 0],
	'num_wings': [2, 0, 0, 0],
	'num_specimen_seen': [10, 2, 1, 8]},
	index=['falcon', 'dog', 'spider', 'fish'])
df
